intro: Olyra fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered milkbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Olyra fasciculata is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing on rocky soils and in open woodlands. It has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, particularly in treating respiratory and digestive ailments.
